title: Cabinet positive to launch Jaffna-Pondicherry boat service: Minister
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Minister of Fisheries, Douglas Devananda says that the Cabinet has responded positively to launch a boat service between Jaffna and Pondicherry in India.
The Minister said the Cabinet has also responded in a similar way to launch a flight connecting Palaly and India’s town of Tiruchi.
He added that essential items like kerosene, diesel, fertilizer, milk powder, and medicines can be brought through these services.
Sri Lanka receives 3,500 MT of Gas, new Indian Credit line to support fuel purchasing for another four months – PM
